Charles Pic.label: Charles Pic
Charles Pic.description: Charles Pic is a professional racing driver, who drove in Formula One for 2 full seasons in 2012 and 2013, racing for Marussia F1 Team in the first season and then for Caterham in the second season. Wikipedia

Coo Coo Marlin.label: Coo Coo Marlin
Coo Coo Marlin.description: Clifton "Coo Coo" Marlin was a NASCAR Winston Cup driver who spent 14 years in the series. Wikipedia

Dale Earnhardt, Jr..label: Dale Earnhardt, Jr.
Dale Earnhardt, Jr..description: Ralph Dale Earnhardt, Jr. is an American stock car racing driver and team owner. He is the son of NASCAR Hall of Famer Dale Earnhardt, Sr. He is also the grandson of both NASCAR driver Ralph Earnhardt ... Wikipedia
Dale Earnhardt, Jr..Born: October 10, 1974 (age 39), Kannapolis, North Carolina, United States

Danica Patrick.label: Danica Patrick
Danica Patrick.description: Danica Sue Patrick is an American auto racing driver, model and advertising spokeswoman. She is the most successful woman in the history of American open-wheel racing—her win in the 2008 Indy Japan ... Wikipedia

Adrián Campos.label: Adrián Campos
Adrián Campos.description: Adrián Campos Suñer is a retired Formula One driver from Spain. He participated in 21 Grands Prix, debuting on 12 April 1987, without scoring a championship point. He later moved into team management, with more success. Wikipedia

Dario Franchitti.label: Dario Franchitti
Dario Franchitti.description: George Dario Marino Franchitti is a British racing driver from Scotland. Now retired, he won the IndyCar Series four times; in 2007, and three titles consecutively between 2009 and 2011. Wikipedia

Al Herman.label: Al Herman
Al Herman.description:
Al Herman was an American racecar driver.
Born in Topton, Pennsylvania, Herman died in West Haven, Connecticut as a result of injuries sustained in a midget car crash at the West Haven Speedway. Wikipedia
Al Herman.Died: June 18, 1960, West Haven, Connecticut, United States

Al Keller.label: Al Keller
Al Keller.description:
Al Keller was an American racecar driver.
Keller participated in the NASCAR "Strictly Stock"/"Grand National" series from 1949 to 1956 with 29 career starts. Wikipedia

Alan Jones (racing driver).label: Alan Jones
Alan Jones (racing driver).description: Alan Stanley Jones MBE is an Australian former Formula One driver. He was the first driver to win a Formula One World Championship with the Williams team, becoming the 1980 World Drivers' Champion and ... Wikipedia

Hiroki Yoshimoto.label: Hiroki Yoshimoto
Hiroki Yoshimoto.description: Hiroki Yoshimoto is a Japanese race car driver. He raced in the 2005 GP2 Series for the BCN Competicion team, alongside the Venezuelan E. J. Viso. For 2006 he was initially teamed with the more experienced Timo Glock of Germany. Wikipedia

Alan Rees.label: Alan Rees
Alan Rees.description: Alan Rees is a British former racing driver from Wales. He participated in three World Championship Grands Prix in the 1960s, although two of those appearances were driving Formula 2 cars. He scored no championship points. Wikipedia

Alan Rollinson.label: Alan Rollinson
Alan Rollinson.description: Alan Rollinson is a British former racing driver from England. He entered one Formula One World Championship Grand Prix, the 1965 British Grand Prix, with a Cooper T71/73 run by Gerard Racing, but he failed to qualify. Wikipedia

Alberto Ascari.label: Alberto Ascari
Alberto Ascari.description: Alberto Ascari was an Italian racing driver and twice Formula One World Champion. He is one of only two Italian Formula One World Champions in the history of the sport, and the only one to win his two championships in a Ferrari. Wikipedia

Alberto Crespo.label: Alberto Crespo
Alberto Crespo.description: Alberto Augusto Crespo was a racing driver from Buenos Aires, Argentina. He entered one World Championship Formula One Grand Prix, the 1952 Italian Grand Prix, with a Maserati entered for him by Enrico Platé. Crespo narrowly failed to qualify. Wikipedia

Alex Caffi.label: Alex Caffi
Alex Caffi.description: Alessandro "Alex" Caffi is a former Formula One driver from Italy. He participated in 75 Grands Prix, debuting on September 7, 1986. In 2006 he raced in the inaugural season of the Grand Prix Masters formula for retired Formula One drivers. Wikipedia

Alex Yoong.label: Alex Yoong
Alex Yoong.description:
Alexander Charles Yoong Loong, is a Malaysian Chinese race car driver of European and Han Chinese parentage.
Yoong began his career in saloon cars before moving into the Proton one-make series. Wikipedia

Alfredo Pián.label: Alfredo Pián
Alfredo Pián.description: Alfredo Pián was a racing driver from Argentina. He entered the 1950 Monaco Grand Prix with a Maserati 4CLT run by Scuderia Achille Varzi. Wikipedia

Allen Berg.label: Allen Berg
Allen Berg.description:
Allen Bernard Berg is a former racing driver who raced for the Osella team in Formula One.
He began in karting in 1978 and switched to cars when he was 20, into Formula Atlantic. Wikipedia

André Simon (racing driver).label: André Simon
André Simon (racing driver).description: André Simon was a racing driver from France. He participated in Formula One from 1951 to 1957, participating in a total of 12 World Championship races but scoring no championship points. Wikipedia

Andy Linden (racing driver).label: Andy Linden
Andy Linden (racing driver).description: Andy Linden was an American racecar driver from Brownsville, Pennsylvania. Having served as a US Marine, he raced with great success until a 1957 crash caused a piece of metal to break his helmet, causing career ending brain damage. Wikipedia

Art Bisch.label: Art Bisch
Art Bisch.description: Art Bisch, was an American racecar driver. Bisch died two days after sustaining head and chest injuries when his Champ Car smashed into the guard rail and rolled over twice at Lakewood Speedway in July 1958. Wikipedia

Asdrúbal Fontes Bayardo.label: Asdrúbal Fontes Bayardo
Asdrúbal Fontes Bayardo.description:
Asdrúbal Esteban Fontes Bayardo, sometimes known as "Pocho" was a racing driver from Uruguay.
During the mid to late 1950s, Fontes Bayardo participated in the fiercely competitive Argentine Formula ... Wikipedia

Ayrton Senna.label: Ayrton Senna
Ayrton Senna.description: Ayrton Senna da Silva was a Brazilian racing driver who won three Formula One world championships. He was killed in an accident while leading the 1994 San Marino Grand Prix. Wikipedia
Ayrton Senna.Born: March 21, 1960, São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Basil van Rooyen.label: Basil van Rooyen
Basil van Rooyen.description: Basil van Rooyen is a former racing driver from South Africa. He participated in two Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on 1 January 1968. He retired from both, scoring no championship points. Wikipedia

Bertrand Gachot.label: Bertrand Gachot
Bertrand Gachot.description: Bertrand Gachot is a French former racing driver. Wikipedia

Bill Aston.label: Bill Aston
Bill Aston.description:
William "Bill" Aston was a British racing driver who participated in three Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, for his own team Aston Butterworth.
Prior to taking part in Formula One, Aston was a test pilot and motorcycle racer. Wikipedia

Bill Brack.label: Bill Brack
Bill Brack.description: William Brack is a former racing driver. He originally became involved in auto racing in the early 1960s, in the form of ice-racing Minis in Huntsville, Ontario. Wikipedia

Bob Evans (racing driver).label: Bob Evans
Bob Evans (racing driver).description: Robert "Bob" Evans is a British former racing driver from England. He participated in 11 World Championship Formula One Grands Prix, debuting on 1 March 1975. He scored no championship points. Wikipedia

Bob Scott (racing driver).label: Bob Scott
Bob Scott (racing driver).description: Bob Scott was an American racecar driver. Scott died in a crash during a Champ Car race at Darlington Raceway. Wikipedia
Bob Scott (racing driver).Died: July 5, 1954, Darlington, South Carolina, United States

Bob Veith.label: Bob Veith
Bob Veith.description:
Bob Veith was an American racecar driver.
Veith drove in the AAA and USAC Championship Car series, racing from 1955 to 1968 with 63 starts. He finished in the top ten 37 times, with a best finish of 2nd twice, both in 1958. Wikipedia
Bob Veith.Died: March 29, 2006, Santa Rosa, California, United States

Bobby Grim.label: Bobby Grim
Bobby Grim.description:
Robert "Bobby" Grim was an American racecar driver.
Born in Coal City, Indiana, Grim died of cancer in Indianapolis, Indiana. Wikipedia

Boy Hayje.label: Boy Hayje
Boy Hayje.description: Johan "Boy" Hayje is a former racing driver from the Netherlands. He participated in seven Formula One Grands Prix, debuting on 29 August 1976. He scored no championship points. Wikipedia

Brian Hart.label: Brian Hart
Brian Hart.description: Brian Hart was a British racing driver and engineer with a background in the aviation industry. He is best known as the founder of Brian Hart Limited, a company that developed and built engines for motorsport use. Wikipedia
Brian Hart.Born: September 7, 1936, London Borough of Enfield, United Kingdom

Brian McGuire.label: Brian McGuire
Brian McGuire.description: Brian McGuire is an American actor/writer/musician/DJ/producer, most notable for the indie comedy/romance directed by Alex Holdridge, In Search of a Midnight Kiss, a black-and-white movie that mixes ... Wikipedia
Movies: In Search of a Midnight Kiss
Everything Will Happen Before You Die

Bruce Halford.label: Bruce Halford
Bruce Halford.description:
Bruce Halford was a British racing driver from England. He was born in Hampton-in-Arden and educated at Blundell's School
Halford drove in Formula One from 1956 to 1960, participating in nine World ... Wikipedia

Bruce Kessler.label: Bruce Kessler
Bruce Kessler.description:
Bruce Kessler is an American racing driver and film and television director.
He entered one World Championship Formula One Grand Prix with a Connaught owned by Bernie Ecclestone, but failed to qualify, ... Wikipedia

Bruce McLaren.label: Bruce McLaren
Bruce McLaren.description:
Bruce Leslie McLaren was a New Zealand race-car designer, driver, engineer and inventor.
His name lives on in the McLaren team which has been one of the most successful in Formula One championship ... Wikipedia

Cal Niday.label: Cal Niday
Cal Niday.description: Cal Niday was an American racecar driver. He lost his leg in a motorcycle accident after high school, but it did not affect his race car driving career. Cal is also noted as the first racer to wear a modern style Bell helmet in the Indy 500. Wikipedia

Carlos Pace.label: Carlos Pace
Carlos Pace.description: José Carlos Pace was a racing driver from Brazil. He participated in 73 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on March 4, 1972. He won one race, achieved six podiums, and scored a total of 58 championship points. Wikipedia
Carlos Pace.Born: October 6, 1944, São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Carroll Shelby.label: Carroll Shelby
Carroll Shelby.description: Carroll Hall Shelby was an American automotive designer, racing driver and entrepreneur. He was best known for his involvement with the AC Cobra and later the Mustang-based performance cars for Ford ... Wikipedia

Cesare Perdisa.label: Cesare Perdisa
Cesare Perdisa.description: Cesare Perdisa was a racing driver from Bologna, Italy. He participated in 8 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on May 22, 1955. He achieved 2 podiums, and scored a total of 5 championship points. Wikipedia

Chet Miller.label: Chet Miller
Chet Miller.description: Chet Miller was an American racecar driver. He was killed in a crash in the south turn of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway during practice for the 1953 Indianapolis 500. During his long Indy career, Miller earned the nickname "Dean of the Speedway." Wikipedia

Chico Landi.label: Chico Landi
Chico Landi.description: Francisco Sacco Landi, better known as Chico, was a racing driver from São Paulo, Brazil. He participated in six Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on September 16, 1951. Wikipedia
Chico Landi.Born: July 14, 1907, São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil
Chico Landi.Died: June 7, 1989, São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Chico Serra.label: Chico Serra
Chico Serra.description: Francisco "Chico" Serra is a racing driver from Brazil. He won the 1979 British Formula Three Championship. He participated in 33 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix for Fittipaldi and Arrows, debuting on 15 March 1981. Wikipedia
Chico Serra.Born: February 3, 1957 (age 57), São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Chris Amon.label: Chris Amon
Chris Amon.description: Christopher Arthur Amon MBE is a former motor racing driver. He was active in Formula One – racing in the 1960s and 1970s – and is widely regarded to be one of the best F1 drivers never to win a championship Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Chris Bristow.label: Chris Bristow
Chris Bristow.description:
Chris Bristow, was a British Formula One driver from England.
Bristow was the son of a garage owner from London, and was unmarried. Wikipedia
Chris Bristow.Died: June 19, 1960, Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps, Stavelot, Belgium

Chuck Daigh.label: Chuck Daigh
Chuck Daigh.description: Chuck Daigh was an American racing car driver. He broke into Grand Prix racing through Lance Reventlow's Scarab team, through the virtue of being one of the resident engineers. Wikipedia
Chuck Daigh.Born: November 29, 1923, Long Beach, California, United States
Chuck Daigh.Died: April 29, 2008, Newport Beach, California, United States

Clive Puzey.label: Clive Puzey
Clive Puzey.description: Clive Puzey is a former racing driver from Rhodesia. He began taking part in the South African Formula One Championship in 1963 with a Lotus 18/21, finishing seventh in the Rand Grand Prix the following year. Wikipedia

Corrado Fabi.label: Corrado Fabi
Corrado Fabi.description: Corrado Fabi is a former racing driver from Italy. He participated in 18 Formula One Grands Prix, debuting on 13 March 1983, scoring no championship points. He was the 1982 European Formula Two Champion driving a March-BMW. Wikipedia

Damon Hill.label: Damon Hill
Damon Hill.description: Damon Graham Devereux Hill OBE is a retired British racing driver from England. He is the son of the late Graham Hill, and is the only son of a world champion to win the title. His father died in an aeroplane crash when Hill was 15. Wikipedia

Dan Gurney.label: Dan Gurney
Dan Gurney.description:
Daniel Sexton Gurney is a retired American racing driver, race car constructor, and team owner.
The son of a Metropolitan Opera star, he was born in Port Jefferson, New York, but moved to California as a teenager. Wikipedia
Dan Gurney.Born: April 13, 1931 (age 82), Port Jefferson, New York, United States

David Hobbs (racing driver).label: David Hobbs
David Hobbs (racing driver).description: David Wishart Hobbs is a British former racing driver. Originally employed as a commentator for the Speed Channel, he currently works as a commentator for NBC and NBC Sports Network. Wikipedia

Dennis Taylor (racing driver).label: Dennis Taylor
Dennis Taylor (racing driver).description: Dennis Taylor was a British racing driver from England. He competed in 500cc Formula 3 from 1952 to 1954. His single World Championship Formula One entry was at the 1959 British Grand Prix driving his Formula 2 Lotus 12, and he failed to qualify. Wikipedia

Derek Daly.label: Derek Daly
Derek Daly.description: Derek Daly is a former racing driver from Ireland. He won the 1977 British Formula Three Championship, and competed as a professional racing driver for 17 years participating in 64 World Championship ... Wikipedia

Desmond Titterington.label: Desmond Titterington
Desmond Titterington.description: Desmond Titterington was a British racing driver from Northern Ireland. He participated in one Formula One World Championship Grand Prix, on July 14, 1956. He scored no championship points. He also competed in several non-Championship Grand Prix. Wikipedia

Didier Pironi.label: Didier Pironi
Didier Pironi.description: Didier Joseph Louis Pironi was a racing driver from France. During his career he competed in 72 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, driving for Tyrrell, Ligier and Ferrari. Wikipedia

Duke Nalon.label: Duke Nalon
Duke Nalon.description: Dennis "Duke" Nalon was a midget car, sprint car, and Indy 500 driver from Chicago, Illinois, United States. Wikipedia

Ed Elisian.label: Ed Elisian
Ed Elisian.description: Ed Elisian was an American racing driver, mainly competing in the National Championship. He died in a crash at the Milwaukee Mile. Wikipedia

Eddie Cheever.label: Eddie Cheever
Eddie Cheever.description: Edward "Eddie" McKay Cheever, Jr. is an American racing driver who raced for almost thirty years in Formula One, sports cars, CART and the Indy Racing League. Wikipedia

Emerson Fittipaldi.label: Emerson Fittipaldi
Emerson Fittipaldi.description: Emerson Fittipaldi is a Brazilian former automobile racing driver who won both the Formula One World Championship and the Indianapolis 500 twice each and the CART championship once. Wikipedia
Emerson Fittipaldi.Born: December 12, 1946 (age 67), São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Eppie Wietzes.label: Eppie Wietzes
Eppie Wietzes.description: Egbert "Eppie" Wietzes is a former racing driver from Canada. Wikipedia

Eric van de Poele.label: Eric van de Poele
Eric van de Poele.description: Eric van de Poele is a Belgian racing driver and former Formula One driver. He participated in 29 Grands Prix, debuting on 10 March 1991. He scored no championship points. Wikipedia

Ernst Klodwig.label: Ernst Klodwig
Ernst Klodwig.description: Ernst Klodwig was a racing driver from East Germany. He participated in two Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, driving privately run BMWs with different engines. He was classified in both races with a best finish of 12th. Wikipedia

Ernst Loof.label: Ernst Loof
Ernst Loof.description: Ernst Loof was an automotive engineer and racing driver from Neindorf, Germany. He contributed to the design of the BMW 328 sports car in the late 1930s. Wikipedia

Ettore Chimeri.label: Ettore Chimeri
Ettore Chimeri.description:
Ettore Muro Chimeri was a racing driver from Venezuela. He was born in Lodi, near Milan, Italy, but his family later settled in Venezuela.
He became a popular gentleman racing driver and competed with success in many local races in Venezuela. Wikipedia

Felice Bonetto.label: Felice Bonetto
Felice Bonetto.description: Felice Bonetto was a racing driver who raced in Formula One for the Maserati, Scuderia Milano and Alfa Romeo teams. Wikipedia

Franco Forini.label: Franco Forini
Franco Forini.description: Franco Forini is a former racing driver from Switzerland. He competed in the Italian Formula Three Championship between 1981 and 1985, winning the title in his final year in a Dallara-Volkswagen with ... Wikipedia

Franco Rol.label: Franco Rol
Franco Rol.description: Franco Rol was a racing driver from Italy. He participated in five Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, debuting on May 21, 1950. He scored no championship points. He also participated in many non-championship Formula One events. Wikipedia

Frank Armi.label: Frank Armi
Frank Armi.description: Frank Armi was an American racecar driver. Armi's racing career ended in the mid-1960s, when he became a television and film sound engineer. Wikipedia

Frank Dochnal.label: Frank Dochnal
Frank Dochnal.description: Frank J. Dochnal was a race car driver from St. Louis, Missouri, United States. He had some success in local racing in Missouri before making a single attempt to qualify for a Formula One Grand Prix at ... Wikipedia

Geki (racing driver).label: Geki
Geki (racing driver).description: "Geki" was the racing pseudonym of Giacomo Russo, who was a racing driver from Italy. An experienced driver in the Italian lower formulae, he also participated in three Formula One Italian Grands Prix ... Wikipedia

Gene Force.label: Gene Force
Gene Force.description:
Gene Force was an American racecar driver.
Born in New Madison, Ohio, Force died in Brooklyn, Michigan as a result a heart attack at Michigan International Speedway. Wikipedia

Geoff Lees.label: Geoff Lees
Geoff Lees.description: Geoffrey Lees is a former racing driver from England. He participated in 12 Formula One World Championship Grands Prix, making his first appearance on 16 July 1978. He scored no championship points. Wikipedia

George Connor (racing driver).label: George Connor
George Connor (racing driver).description: George Connor was an American racecar driver. Wikipedia

Gianni Morbidelli.label: Gianni Morbidelli
Gianni Morbidelli.description: Gianni Morbidelli is a racing driver from Italy. He is the son of Giancarlo Morbidelli, the founder of Morbidelli motorcycle company which had success in Grand Prix motorcycle racing. Wikipedia

Graham Hill.label: Graham Hill
Graham Hill.description: Norman Graham Hill OBE was a British racing driver and team owner from England, who was a two time Formula One World Champion. Wikipedia

Gunnar Nilsson.label: Gunnar Nilsson
Gunnar Nilsson.description:
Gunnar Nilsson was a Swedish racing driver, born in Helsingborg. Before entering Formula One, he won the 1975 British Formula Three Championship.
Nilsson entered 32 Formula One Grand Prix races, qualifying for all of them. Wikipedia

Guy Edwards.label: Guy Edwards
Guy Edwards.description: Guy Richard Goronwy Edwards, QGM is a former racing driver from England. Best known for his sportscar and British Formula One career, as well as for brokering sponsorship deals, Edwards participated in ... Wikipedia

Guy Ligier.label: Guy Ligier
Guy Ligier.description:
Guy Ligier is a French former rugby player and racing driver.
He first made his name as a rugby player in the late 1940s when he was working as a butcher's assistant in his home town of Vichy. Wikipedia

Guy Tunmer.label: Guy Tunmer
Guy Tunmer.description: Percival Guy Tunmer was a racing driver from South Africa. He participated in one Formula One World Championship Grand Prix, his home race in 1975, driving a Lotus 72 for a local team, Team Gunston. He finished 11th, scoring no championship points. Wikipedia

Hans Heyer.label: Hans Heyer
Hans Heyer.description: Hans Heyer is a racing driver from Wegberg, the site of the Grenzlandring, a former high speed race track oval. He mainly raced touring cars, being popular with the fans for his rather funny style. Wikipedia

Hap Sharp.label: Hap Sharp
Hap Sharp.description: James "Hap" Sharp was an American race car driver who drove in six Formula One grands prix. But he was best known as co-owner and driver of the revolutionary Chaparral sports racing cars built by Jim Hall and Sharp in Midland, Texas. Wikipedia

Heinz Schiller.label: Heinz Schiller
Heinz Schiller.description: Heinz Schiller, was a racing driver from Switzerland. He participated in one Formula One World Championship Grand Prix, on August 5, 1962. He retired from the race, scoring no championship points. Wikipedia

Helmuth Koinigg.label: Helmuth Koinigg
Helmuth Koinigg.description:
Helmuth Koinigg was an Austrian racing driver who died in a crash in the 1974 United States Grand Prix, only his second Grand Prix start.
Koinigg was born in Vienna. Wikipedia

Henry Taylor (racing driver).label: Henry Taylor
Henry Taylor (racing driver).description: Henry Taylor was a British racing driver from England. Wikipedia

Ian Ashley.label: Ian Ashley
Ian Ashley.description:
Ian Hugh Gordon Ashley is a British racing driver who raced in Formula One for the Token, Williams, BRM and Hesketh teams.
Ashley began racing in 1966 when he took a course at the Jim Russell Racing School. Wikipedia

Innes Ireland.label: Innes Ireland
Innes Ireland.description: Robert McGregor Innes Ireland, was a British military officer, engineer, and motor racing driver. He was a larger-than-life character who, according to a rival team boss, "lived without sense, without ... Wikipedia

Ivor Bueb.label: Ivor Bueb
Ivor Bueb.description:
Ivor Léon John Bueb was a sports car racing and Formula One driver from England.
Bueb started racing seriously in a Formula 3 500cc Cooper in 1953, graduating to the Cooper works team in 1955 when he finished second in the British championship. Wikipedia
Ivor Bueb.Born: June 6, 1923, London Borough of Southwark, London, United Kingdom

Jacky Ickx.label: Jacky Ickx
Jacky Ickx.description: Jacques Bernard "Jacky" Ickx is a Belgian former racing driver who won the highly prestigious 24 Hours of Le Mans six times, and he also achieved eight wins and 25 podium finishes in Formula One, and is a former winner of the Dakar Rally. Wikipedia

James Hunt.label: James Hunt
James Hunt.description: James Simon Wallis Hunt was a British racing driver who won the Formula One World Championship in 1976. After retiring from racing in 1979, Hunt became a media commentator and businessman. Wikipedia
James Hunt.Born: August 29, 1947, Belmont, Sutton, London, United Kingdom

Jan Flinterman.label: Jan Flinterman
Jan Flinterman.description: Johannes Leonardus "Jan" Flinterman was a distinguished Dutch air force pilot during World War II and a racing driver. Together with Dries van der Lof, he was the first driver from the Netherlands to compete in Formula One. Wikipedia
